speaker: Misha
line: What is this place...?

speaker: Himeko
line: Does this place ring any bells, Misha?

speaker: Misha
line: I... don't know, but I feel a sense of deja vu. What is this place?

speaker: Himeko
line: It's the realm within a dream bubble. This was left to the Astral Express by a Nameless , but weirdly when we entered it, it was completely empty.

speaker: Himeko
line: Dr. Edward from the Dreamscape Sales Store told me that dreams are formed from memories, and a dream bubble can't take shape if its core is empty.

speaker: Himeko
line: So I thought you might be able to help us in unraveling this mystery, Misha? As a hotel doorman , you know Penacony best among us.

speaker: Misha
line: Hmm, I don't know much about dream bubbles, but if you want to figure out what this mansion is... I'll do my best!

speaker: Himeko
line: I'm counting on you then.

speaker: March 7th
line: Himeko... I still don't get it. Why were you so sure that Misha had a connection with this dream bubble ?

speaker: Himeko
line: I wasn't sure. It was just a hunch, but since Misha feels familiar with this place... my hunch might be correct.

text: This place looks a bit familiar...
This place feels a bit nostalgic...

speaker: Himeko
line: Exactly, this is where you and Firefly encountered "Death," which we now know as "Dormancy." Considering its connection to Dreamflux Reef , it's not surprising it appeared here.

speaker: Himeko
line: The question now is — Who brought you here? Based on the clues we have so far, it's unlikely to be that Masked Fool , so identifying them is crucial to us.

speaker: Himeko
line: We're drawing closer to the truth once more. Let's give Misha some time, as I believe he'll unveil the secret of this dream bubble.

speaker: March 7th
line: Alright, but there are doors all over the place... Which one should we choose...? Do you have any idea, Misha?

speaker: Misha
line: Hmm... I guess... maybe this way?

text: Follow Misha and help him recover his memories

title: Mission Description
content: Time reverses to the point before you left Dreamflux Reef. Himeko returns fromGolden Hourwith a powerful deduction: There may be some inextricable link between the empty dream bubble thatthe Watchmakeris holding and Misha the bellboy.In order to prove it, you take Misha back into Mikhail's dream bubble... If everything goes as expected, the truth may be lurking here in this long dream of the child.

speaker: Misha
line: I... I'm not entirely sure, but... let's give it a try.

text: (Enter the room at the end of the corridor)

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, you managed to choose the right door on your first try?

speaker: Misha
line: Weird, this place is quite different from the hotel, but I just... I feel like I've been here before and... even lived here for a while.

speaker: Misha
line: If I remember correctly, there should be a fireplace down that hallway. Clockie and I used to sit by the fire, listening to the crackling of firewood.

speaker: Misha
line: And... And the room on the other side was... the toy room. I loved spreading out all the toys from the box on the floor and making up stories for each of them.

speaker: Misha
line: Hold on, this doesn't make sense. Didn't I grow up in Dreamflux Reef? So, what is this place...?

speaker: Himeko
line: This could be a case of amnesia. But don't worry, Misha, it's common for everyone to forget certain aspects of the past. Those memories haven't vanished. They're just lying in the depths of your mind. We can surely get them back.

speaker: Himeko
line: Since this place seems familiar to you, why don't we explore a few more rooms and see if you can recall anything more?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, then let's check out the rooms I just mentioned.

text: Search the rooms on either side
(Approach the designated spot in front of the fireplace)

speaker: March 7th
line: Mikhail, that's the name. Now we all know him as the Watchmaker.

speaker: March 7th
line: So, who is he talking to? Do you know anything about it, Misha?

speaker: Misha
line: I'm sorry, I don't know much about the Watchmaker, but Mikhail...

speaker: Himeko
line: Anything special about that name?

speaker: Misha
line: Mikhail... is Grandpa's name.

speaker: March 7th
line: Grandpa? Do you mean... you're the Watchmaker's grandson?

speaker: Himeko
line: But we haven't heard anything about the Watchmaker having descendants, and the name "Mikhail" is not rare. Perhaps it's merely a coincidence.

speaker: Himeko
line: Could you tell us more about your grandpa Mikhail?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, sure. He was a seafarer who fearlessly ventured into mysterious seas and storms. He was always on the sea and had a lot of friends who accompanied him on his travels.

speaker: Misha
line: He didn't want me to call him "Grandpa" because that would make him sound old. He believed he was still young. The name "Mikhail" was given to him by his parents, Mihaly and Elise, both renowned seafarers.

speaker: Misha
line: Every time he came back, he'd share his logbook with me and tell me about his adventures at sea. I want to become a great adventurer just like him.

speaker: March 7th
line: It appears that the seafarer has nothing to do with the Watchmaker. So, perhaps it's just a coincidence?

speaker: March 7th
line: So, where is your grandpa now?

speaker: Misha
line: He went off on a new journey, and it's been quite a while since I last saw him.

speaker: Misha
line: So, where has Clockie gone...? Did he leave to protect Dreamville?

text: ▶ So, you need to keep yourself safe, too...
(Approach the designate spot in the toy room)

speaker: Misha
line: I heard some noises from the room... Origami Bird ? That's a friend of mine.

speaker: March 7th
line: You and Origami Bird are friends?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, it's a member of the Compass crew, just like Clockie and Miss Mirror. And there's more than just one Origami Bird! They are a big family with lots of brothers and sisters who look the same.

speaker: Misha
line: They follow Miss Mirror's orders and handle all sorts of jobs on the ship. They're the best sailors.

speaker: March 7th
line: Sailors? Can Origami Birds be sailors...?

speaker: Himeko
line: Could you tell us more about the "Compass," Misha?

speaker: Misha
line: The "Compass" is a ship bound for the New World! Clockie and his partners travel through layers of fog to the depths of the sea. Whenever there is danger, Clockie will use a compass and guide the ship in the right direction!

speaker: Himeko
line: That's a great story, but in the Penacony cartoon, Clockie and his partners have always lived in Dreamville and never ventured out, right?

speaker: Misha
line: Huh? Oh... that does seem to be the case.

speaker: Misha
line: Weird... I clearly remember... Clockie arrived in the New World in the end...

speaker: Himeko
line: Perhaps Clockie has a hidden past.

text: ▶ This is an origami bird I made for you...
▶ It will protect you from harm
▶ Just like they did with Clockie...

speaker: Misha
line: I think I hear the sound of water...

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer) once mentioned there's a magnificent fountain up ahead.

text: Continue following Misha and help him recover his memories

speaker: March 7th
line: Look, there it is.

speaker: Misha
line: "The water resembles a precious jewel, embedded in the dreams of all seafarers."

speaker: Misha
line: "Every time I gaze at the shimmering lights beneath the waves, it feels as though I'm back in this place, standing by your side..."

speaker: Himeko
line: Have you recalled anything, Misha?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, I saw these sentences in Grandpa's logbook. He used to say that despite the perils of the sea, whenever he stood on the deck in the afternoon, overlooking the sparkling waves, he would think of this fountain in front of his house.

speaker: Misha
line: He often said that those moments felt like returning to his family's side, and the difficulties at sea didn't seem quite as challenging.

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* You know, I quite understand such sentiments...

text: Don't sigh, or you'll start getting gray hair...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey, don't tease! I was just being a bit sentimental.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I'm not an elder. I was just being a bit sentimental.

speaker: Himeko
line: Perhaps every adventurer far from home carries a fountain within their soul. Even though the other side of the sea remains shrouded in the unknown, the fountain in front of his house serves as a compass, leading him back to his cherished ones.

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, while Grandpa was at home, we would stand by the fountain and place the "Compass" — a toy boat that I made — into the pool!

speaker: Misha
line: Back then, I would ask him when I could go on adventures like him, and he would always laugh and say I was still too young.

speaker: March 7th
line: It seems this "Mikhail" is truly a seafarer and has nothing to do with the Watchmaker.

speaker: Himeko
line: Yeah, based on Misha's recollections, the scenes in the dream bubble appear to be his childhood memories.

speaker: March 7th
line: But this raises more questions. According to Misha, he was clearly born on an oceanic planet and led an ordinary life, with no connection to Penacony at all...

speaker: March 7th
line: Could this be some sort of metaphor? Perhaps the "sea" refers to the Memory Zone?

speaker: Misha
line: I'm sorry. I don't know, but my memories keep pouring out uncontrollably, like water flowing from a fountain...

speaker: Misha
line: Perhaps... I'll remember more things if we go further...

speaker: March 7th
line: We're going to the opposite side, right?

speaker: Misha
line: No, we should turn left here...

text: ▶ I wish to share your burden...

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Something feels different about this place?

speaker: Misha
line: This is it. I remember this corridor.

text: ▶ Can you take me with you...

speaker: Misha
line: Up ahead is... Grandpa's study. It was in that room that I saw him the last time.

text: Captain Misha, we are now heading in the correct direction!
Not even the sea can stop us!
We've finally come out of the fog! Across the ocean is our destination!
We've lost our way so many times.
But in the end, we've arrived at the New World!

speaker: March 7th
line: The atmosphere in this room feels totally different.

speaker: Clockie
line: Misha! You've finally come!

speaker: Misha
line: Clockie, you're here! Yeah, this is the room where we first met each other...

speaker: Himeko
line: Are those books on the bookshelf logbooks left behind by that seafarer?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, whenever he came back, he'd place a logbook on the bookshelf in his room. They contain records of his expeditions to every corner of the world.

speaker: Misha
line: He described our world as a fountain. At some point, the sea started to gradually swallow up the land where people lived.

speaker: Misha
line: To ensure that everyone had land to settle on, he had to continue exploring the sea and search for the source of the rising seawater.

speaker: Misha
line: On that day, he called me to his study, telling me that he was embarking on another journey. However, I could sense the gravity in his expression. It was the same look I had seen on my father's face before his final voyage.

speaker: Misha
line: I asked him if I could go with him, but he said that my adventure lay elsewhere and told me to stay home and patiently await a certain sound at the door.

speaker: March 7th
line: What sound?

speaker: Misha
line: He told me about a vast ocean in the sky — an ocean of stars. He spoke of a train that transports children with a desire to venture far away, traversing the sea of stars without ever stopping.

speaker: Misha
line: He said that he knew the crew on the train, and that he had asked them to take me along. He said the journey I had always dreamed of... would start there.

speaker: March 7th
line: A train? Could it be...

speaker: Misha
line: It's the Astral Express. I remember now, Grandpa's friends are a group of Nameless who came to this world to resolve a disaster caused by a star.

speaker: Misha
line: Then he gave his pocket watch to me. It was his cherished treasure, appearing in every one of his adventure tales. He explained that difficult times were ahead but assured me that the watch would guide me.

speaker: Misha
line: He said, as long as I kept moving forward, I'd eventually reach my desired destination. And then, it was as if I heard...

speaker: Misha
line: The distant sound of a train whistle, echoing throughout the room...

speaker: Clockie
line: Exactly, Misha! And then we followed that whistle, didn't we?

speaker: Misha
line: Yeah, I think I can still find the way we took back then.

text: Find a way to get to the other end of the room

speaker: March 7th
line: This is the Dream Jigsaw, right? So, we're supposed to find the exit? But where can we find the last piece...?

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ Do you remember, (Trailblazer)? You said you obtained a mysterious shard when you stumbled into this place.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, the shape seems to match. So, this shard is also connected to Misha?

speaker: Himeko
line: Looks like we're just one step from revealing the truth. Let's get to the other side and investigate.

text: Go to the other end of the room

speaker: Misha
line: This is it. This... is my room of clocks .

speaker: Misha
line: While I spent my time waiting for Grandpa to return from his voyage, Walder gave me this workshop, and it became my "secret base"...

speaker: Misha
line: Here, I learned how to repair clockwork and gears out of my fondness of precision mechanics. In my dreams, I was the captain of the "Compass," embarking on adventures with my companions, Clockie and Miss Mirror, in search of the New World.

speaker: Misha
line: I... I was born and raised here.

speaker: Himeko
line: So, this building in the dream bubble is your childhood "home."

speaker: Misha
line: Yes, but not exactly. To be more precise...

speaker: Misha
line: This "dream bubble" itself is my home.

speaker: Himeko
line: Looks like you've remembered everything now.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, wait! Why does it feel like everyone else knows something I don't?

text: Yeah, you're the only one still in the dark.
Too bad I don't know either...

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ March, do you remember when (Trailblazer) mentioned a "Clockie" that only ( he / she ) could see?

speaker: March 7th
line: Yeah, the little guy here, right? But we all saw him in Dreamflux Reef, right? And Mr. Yang even greeted him.

speaker: Clockie
line: Looks like everyone on the Astral Express has a childlike spirit!

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ The answer lies in the Astral Express. (Trailblazer)'s experience shows that neither Firefly nor Acheron can see this Clockie.

speaker: Himeko
line: And when we were in Dreamflux Reef, you may have noticed that for some reason, nobody outside of the Crew ... had ever talked with Clockie.

speaker: Himeko
line: A memetic life that can only be seen by a select few... It's just like a hidden message... left by someone for the Nameless.

speaker: March 7th
line: But Misha can see Clockie, too, right? They even grew up together, but Misha hasn't started the way of the Trailblaze yet...

speaker: Himeko
line: That's the key to the mystery, March. Now, take a moment to recall...

speaker: Himeko
line: Have you ever seen anyone outside of the Crew interact with Misha?

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait... no way...

speaker: Misha
line: That's the answer, March 7th. This dream bubble is the place where I was born, and I... I'm a dweller in this dream just like a Memory Zone Meme.

speaker: Misha
line: I should have stayed here and waited for you, but when reality and memories merged, I unconsciously pushed open that door and left the bubble with Clockie.

speaker: March 7th
line: So, it's not that the Watchmaker's dream bubble is empty, but rather... the stuff inside ran away?

speaker: March 7th
line: And the whistle you heard was the sound of the Express arriving at Penacony?

speaker: Himeko
line: That's one way to see it, but I believe there is a longer story behind all this. It's best for Misha himself to explain all the details...

speaker: Himeko
line: How about we start with your name ? Now, should we call you Misha? Or...

speaker: Misha
line: Thank you all for helping me rediscover my true self. Now, please allow me to reintroduce myself.

speaker: Misha
line: I was born on Lushaka in the Przesmir system, adopted by seafarers Mikhail and Char. They gave me a treasure, a name that carried their hopes...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Mikhail Char Legwork, or simply... Misha .

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: If you prefer, you can call me by a more familiar name, the Watchmaker.

speaker: March 7th
line: So, you're the Watchmaker himself?

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: Unfortunately, that legendary figure is no more. I'm only a reflection of his life.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: As for the child who has been with you, he's the innocent protagonist of Misha's childhood dream, a friend of Clockie, a young apprentice, and a future mechanic on the Express...

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: And this also marks the beginning of his journey devoted to the Trailblaze.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: At the end of the journey, I left this little flame, which I so cherished, in my deepest dreams, hoping to pass it on to the Nameless of future generations.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: However, he somehow left the dream bubble and forgot all about his task. I apologize for all the confusion this caused.

speaker: Himeko
line: Because he was born with a desire to "trailblaze," wasn't he?

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ I don't think Misha has forgotten his role as a guide. He remembered it, and that's why he mistakenly appeared as a hotel doorman in (Trailblazer)'s dream from the very beginning.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ The one who brought our unconscious (Trailblazer) here must have been Misha. If that's the case, we encountered the Watchmaker's Legacy from the beginning, didn't we?

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: Well, I have a sarcastic friend who says I always take big detours and end up back where I started... Perhaps that's what every Nameless has to go through. [ Note 1 ]

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: But in the end, you've found me. I'm sure you're all wondering what my legacy is. I believe my hound has mentioned the Stellaron and my wealth...

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: If I may apologize, the Stellaron part is real. As for my wealth, however, it's nothing more than a baseless rumor.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: I left my homeland as a child and embarked on the journey of Trailblaze. I traveled to various planets until finally reaching Asdana, where my friends and I built the original Penacony and fought for its future ever since...

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: I've been moving forward all my life, doing what I could to overcome the obstacles in my path. But ultimately, my journey reached its end, and I left behind no possessions worth entrusting...

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: So, if you ask what's left within this worn-out train engine that can be called a "legacy"... I suppose it's the things that are still burning in the engine's furnace.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: Now that you're well aware of the current situation of Penacony, I certainly hope that you'll help me get this world back on track. But I'll leave that decision to you, for the Path of Trailblaze is never paved by others.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: All I have for you is a story and two gifts...

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: I want to give you my pocket watch. It has accompanied me throughout my long journey, guiding that naive child forward, and has been blessed with the presence of so many great people up to this day.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: And my hat, too. The one who navigated for me placed it on my head and planted a fanciful thought in my mind — the Trailblazing expedition will never end.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: Now, it's time for you to make your choice. Once you've made up your mind, open that door and enter the long dream of an old man.

speaker: "The Watchmaker"
line: I'll be waiting for you at the end of this corridor of time.

speaker: Himeko
line: All right, everyone. Let's make a decision.

speaker: Himeko
line: Although I don't think anyone will have any objections.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Of course. We've come this far. Surely there's no other option than moving forward.

text: I want to witness the legacy.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Of course. We've come this far. Surely there's no other option than moving forward.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Come on... Stop joking at a moment like this. We've come this far. Surely there's no other option than moving forward.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: In that case, the vote stands at two to one.

speaker: Himeko
line: Then let's proceed together to the end of this dream... and tell Mikhail our decision.

text: Advance towards the end of the long dream

title: Step Description
content: With the passing of an extremely long night, Misha has finally regained his identity: The oblivious main character in the childhood dream of the Watchmaker, Mikhail Char Legwork — Clockie's friend, a young apprentice, a future Express maintenance engineer... Simultaneously, the origin of an old Nameless' Trailblazing journey.He has completed his mission and the Watchmaker has fulfilled his final, long-awaited wish. Now, the future of Penacony is in your hands.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Mikhail! Where are you going...?

speaker: "Seafarer" Mikhail
line: Someone has to step up and save Lushaka . So, why can't it be me, Misha?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Please, don't go. And if you must, please take me with you... Don't leave me alone...

speaker: "Seafarer" Mikhail
line: Even without me, you know how to proceed forward, brave Captain Misha. The "Compass" is waiting for you. Haven't you always wanted to be a better adventurer than me?

speaker: "Seafarer" Mikhail
line: Now go. Board that train and... start your journey.

speaker: NavigatorFalcon Amundsen
line: Where are you going, Mikhail?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I... I'm going to clean the floor in the Parlor Car! I've promised the conductor...

speaker: Navigator Falcon Amundsen
line: Wait, first tell me, did you fix this watch ?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Um... yeah.

speaker: Navigator Falcon Amundsen
line: I know what it looked like before. Its chain was broken, the back case torn, and the marks on the dial all worn out... How did you manage to fix it?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Well... It's hard to explain, but I knew it could be fixed...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: It's the hands, Mr. Amundsen. Its hands were intact and pointing in the right direction, so I knew there would be a way to fix the rest.

speaker: Navigator Falcon Amundsen
line: I see, you'll work with me from now on. Haven't you always wanted to tinker with this train? You're its mechanic now. As for the conductor , I'll do the talking.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: B—But I only know how to fix watches...

speaker: Navigator Falcon Amundsen
line: Don't worry, you've got what it takes. I'll teach you what you need to know.

speaker: "Navigator"Granholm
line: Where are you going, Legwork? It's time to head to our next stop.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I... I'm staying in Asdana, with Razalina and Tiernan .

speaker: "Navigator" Granholm
line: I see... This place reminds you of home?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: The people of Asdana have only achieved a tiny victory and still have a long way to go... towards true freedom. Hanunue needs us.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Don't worry, not all journeys lead to the stars. Even if I leave the Express, our Path of Trailblaze will continue.

speaker: "Navigator" Granholm
line: Yeah, I knew you wouldn't stay on the Express forever. Leave in peace, my friend, and take this with you.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: This is... Mr. Amundsen's hat? But why...?

speaker: "Navigator" Granholm
line: When he departed, he said he would leave it to his best student. Well, I suppose the time has come.

speaker: "Navigator" Granholm
line: Farewell, Legwork. Take care of Tiernan and Razalina, and don't forget to... write to us.

speaker: Micah
line: Where are you going, Watchmaker?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Don't worry, Micah. Just going on a little trip.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Someone has to be at the forefront of the interstellar frontier, and I'm the only former Nameless in Penacony. So, why can't it be me?

speaker: Micah
line: Because you're all we have! Have you forgotten about Tiernan? The Cosmos is way more dangerous now! What will happen to Penacony if we lose you, too?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: But what will happen to Penacony if we don't find a way out?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Tiernan... How could I ever forget him? I've spent countless sleepless nights asking myself why I didn't go with him back then.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: We Nameless won't stop... Don't worry, Micah, it's just a matter of getting back to my old profession. Just wait for me to come back. But if, and it's a big if...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: If I don't come back in one piece, then you'll become the next Watchmaker.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Where are you going, old man?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Oh, you're here.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Answer my question. What are you up to?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Relax, Gallagher. I just came up with a great idea. Wanna hear it?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Oh, come on! Aren't all your "ideas" just ways to get yourself killed? I may be blunt here, but you're the last remaining hero in Penacony.

speaker: Gallagher
line: If you die too, the secret of the Stellaron... will go to the grave with you.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Yes, I'm afraid there's no way out in Penacony, so I'll have to consider alternatives beyond Asdana.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: We'll organize a festival, using the "Watchmaker's Legacy" as a facade... and send invitations to the entire Cosmos to gather people here.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So? A desperate struggle against The Family ?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Desperate? Hah, don't we have you here, my friend? This task is challenging, but what hasn't been challenging for us along the way? Well, whatever you do, remember...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Make sure to send an invitation to the Astral Express.

speaker: Clockie
line: Misha! Where are you going?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Oh, it's you, Clockie... Take me to Dreamflux Reef...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Last night, I had a long dream about the day we met. I want to write down that dream.

speaker: Clockie
line: Write it down... Why?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: So I won't forget it. Do you remember how you got your name, Clockie?

speaker: Clockie
line: Of course! You told me that when you were a kid, you lived in a room full of clocks. Those wall clocks and pocket watches grew up with you and were your best friends!

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Yes, but what I didn't mention was... there's a funny misunderstanding behind it.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I was a kid, and there was always a special pocket watch in my memories. It was with my grandpa, guiding him on his sea voyages and leading the way in his every adventure story.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I wanted to have a pocket watch like that too, and that's when you appeared in my dreams.

speaker: Clockie
line: Yeah, every night we boarded the Compass and set sail together!

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: But you know what? It wasn't until the day my grandpa gave it to me that I realized... it wasn't a pocket watch at all...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: It was a compass.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: So, your name should have been "Compassie"...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: And the Watchmaker... is just a Nameless.

text: Take a rest in the moonlight...

title: Step Description
content: Dear future Nameless:I have been waiting for you all this time, future Nameless. Though I know not where you come from, what you look like, or even your name... For now, please allow me to call you the "Trailblazer".I am sure you have learned of who I am by now... A former Astral Express maintenance engineer, an apprentice of little promise, and an old man who lived an entirely unremarkable existence. I set out on the Trailblazing journey so I might learn about life itself and everything within. However, the more I learned, the more I found myself lost in confusion and distress. I thought that I would be able to learn how to live a better life, but all I learned was how to elegantly face the ending fate has paired you with... "Nihility".Everyone in life will eventually find their own answer — to resist or to obey fate — but these questions do not belong to Trailblaze. Although, I fear this question may simply be too profound. I fear evenAkiviliTHEMSELF would not be able to provide a single answer that is unique to Trailblaze. However, as a Nameless... as a person... we have the right to reflect. We have the right to act. We have the right to define our own endings. We have the right to move forward. As we advance down the road to our own ending, there are many things that people are capable of, and our endings will thus take on a completely new meaning. A Nameless does not indulge in temporary dreams, nor would they forsake their birth rights due to pain and suffering.Do you still recall the question I left in my invitation letter, Trailblazer? "Why does life slumber?""People slumber so that, eventually, they can awaken from their dreams." ...This is the answer that an old Nameless devoted his entire life to finding.

speaker: Clockie
line: We've arrived at Dreamflux Reef. So, where to next?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: You know, Clockie. I don't think... I'll be going anywhere else.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I've traveled far enough, and it's time for a little break...

speaker: Clockie
line: Oh, so we'll set out again when you're rested?

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: No, I'll stay here, and then... this is where it ends.

speaker: Clockie
line: This is where it ends? What do you mean, Misha?

speaker: Clockie
line: You told me that the Trailblazing expedition would never end.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Yeah, that's what I said...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: So now, it's up to you to decide your next destination.

speaker: Clockie
line: My next destination? What's that supposed to be? I've been following you...

speaker: Clockie
line: Misha? You're acting weird today! If you're feeling down, we can just do what we usually do... with the clockwork!

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: No, I'm not feeling down. As for clockwork... yeah, it resolves all problems in this dream.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: So, do you know what clockwork actually is?

speaker: Clockie
line: Hmm? I'm not quite sure.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Well, everyone gets lost at times. They may hesitate and doubt which way to go. That happens in this Dreamscape and beyond.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: But don't worry, everyone goes through moments of uncertainty and hesitation. Eventually, they gather the courage to make bold decisions...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Whether it's calming, happy, angry, or sad, all they need is a little nudge to take that step toward where they truly belong.

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: I'm leaving that little nudge with you, and I hope you'll share it with others...

speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
line: Such is the essence of clockwork, the will of the Trailblaze.

children.speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
children.line: Clockie's hands spin around non-stop, indicating confusion, frustration, and weakness.

children.speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
children.line: But ultimately, people still need to move forward,

children.speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
children.line: just like your hands, always pointing ahead.

children.speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
children.line: This is where my journey ends. From now own...

children.speaker: Mikhail Char Legwork
children.line: it is your path to walk.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: means taking paths your predecessors foreswore,

text:
(ObtainTrailblazer (Harmony)Trailblazer (Harmony))
(UnlockJoint Forces: Trailblazer (Harmony))
(ObtainAchievementNessun Dorma)
(MishaMishadeparts from the Astral ExpressVisitor Verification. Can claimStellar Jade×10–35for missed dialogue from theGuest Book)
